newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - January 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - January 7.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Justice and Constitutional Affairs Minister G.L.Peiris says government will be compelled to hold a referendum on devolution if main opposition United National Party opposes it.
The time has come for all communities to think and act "Sri Lankan", instead of along ethnic lines, says President Chandrika Kumaratunga.

Criminal Investigation Department (CID) questions Deputy Defence Minister Anuruddha Ratwatte, following complaint made by UNP politician Anura Bandaranaike. Bandaranaike, President Kumaratunga's brother, alleged that Ratwatte made a criminally defamatory statement at a public rally in September, 1996.
Troops of 'Operation Rivijaya Two' move on rebel camps in eastern Batticaloa, say defence sources.
Foreign Ministry says there is no confirmation that there were Sri Lankans on board ship which went down in the Mediterranean over Christmas.
Local businessmen to finance film on the recent incident where helicopter carrying Ratwatte, Police chief W.B. Rajaguru and Army Commander Rohan Daluwatte, crash landed in rebel territory.
Chief priests of Asgiriya and Malwatte chapters say they want to resign from posts because Buddha Sasana Ministry failed to safeguard Sinhala Buddhist rights.
